a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Death rate from outdoor air pollution in 1990 vs. 2021
Deaths from outdoor particulate matter air pollution per 100,000 people. Countries below the diagonal line have
experienced an increased death rate, whilst those above the line have seen a decreased death rate.
Data source: IHME, Global Burden of Disease (2024)
Note: To allow for comparisons between countries and over time, this metric is age-standardized.
